titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: On Monday afternoon the 8th. of February, I left my sons house N. 57 Mount Vernon Street, Boston, where I had been confined from the preceding 20th. of November, and with my wife, and my son and Mrs Fader, my nurse we travell’d by the Railway to Springfield where we arrived about 8 O’Clock this evening and took lodgings at Warreners.

On Tuesday the 9th. of February at 1. p.m. we took the railway cars for New-Haven through Hartford, and at 5 p.m were embarked at New Haven in a Steamer for New-York which we reached at 9 in the evening, and took lodgings at the city Hotel—

Wednesday 10th of Feby. rain the whole day, which confined us to the house at the city Hall— We had visits in the course of the day—from Walter Hellen and WilliamJohnson, who are on their way from Washington to Utica from AlexanderJohnson, the eldest surviving son of my brother Charles’s younger daughter who was the wife of Alexander Johnson of Utica, in the State of New-York. other visitors were Sidney Brooks, Mr Filch, and Nicholas Saltus

Thursday 11. February 1847. We came from New-York, by the Camden Railroad to Philadelphia where we arrived about 3 p.m. and took lodings at the Union hotel in Chesnut Street, which is however no longer kept by Jones, and no longer in a style satisfactory to the traveller We had no intercourse with any of the other lodgers at the House, and no society but of ourselves

Friday 12. February 1847. My dear wifes seventy-second birth-day— We came by the Railway from Philadelphia to Baltimore where we dined at the United States Hotel and after dinner proceeded by the Railway to Washington We found our carriage waiting for us at the depot and about 8 O’Clock in the evening landed at our house in F. Street.
